TopicTitle: What paint program are you using for flags?

Articles.Content:
So, I wanted to make my own CSP flag. It's just a screenshot with some text for now, but I want to make more out of it. I'm using Firealpaca, what are you using for custom flags? I can't draw that good on virtual paint programs, so, any suggestions for a easy-to-use program for making flags?

Oh, and here is my flag:

![PazOljv.png](http://i.imgur.com/PazOljv.png)

"GIMP"

I don't know why other free image editors exist. GIMP does it all\*

\*that's not even remotely true but I like to pretend.
Paint.

PaintShopPro X3 (never bothered to upgrade to a newer version)

I've been a PSP user since the early '90's as the earliest versions were shareware and supported a wide variety (much wider that than most competitors) of image formats.
Gimp. Flag below.

GIMP for everything. Some bits (such as the die in my avatar) were hand-sketched on white paper with a marker and then scanned in using a program that no longer exists, but the image editing was all done with the Gimp.

IrfanView works fine for me and is very user friendly.

For my flags and patches, I used GIMP like many others. A fun, free program that lets you do all kinds of cool things.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/aSlmh)

..I don't know that many of the really capable paint programs out there are particularly easy to use. I think most replies show people are just using what they know. I've been using PhotoShop since version 3.something so, though I'm not any kind of expert, I can construct some reasonable-looking things. (And I haven't found any other software as capable with text.) IrfanView is a great (free) too for quick tweaks too. 

On the Mac, Pixelmator and Acorn are pretty good. I almost switched entirely to Pixelmator -- great tablet support, but I just couldn't do good enough arrows and text in it, like I could in PhotoShop. I haven't found anything free on Windows that's been good enough to grab my attention. Paint.net did look promising though. But for Windows I've just stuck with an old version of PhotoShop .. and got a newer version of PhotoShop Essentials, which comes bundled with the Wacom Bamboo tablets. 

I haven't made any flags from scratch. I usually looked for real flags, or sci-fi emblems, scaled and cropped them to size, and applied far more vignetting than necessary. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
